ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:01): If it's going to fail on the web scale, it'd be nice to minimise the harm that it causes while failing

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:02): 467f6d43402c6573237052cefcc252db: Right but that is a technical problem which can (in principle) be solved. Focusing on the soluble problem whilst ignoring the hard, systemic issues seems like the wrong approach

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:03): (e.g. by trying to ensure it's defined in a way that fits sensibly within HTML-processor architectures, so that it won't cause those architectures to be changed to accommodate it)

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:09): (...and then it can compete with other approaches to data markup, and can win or lose based on the inherent merits of its design rather than on the bugginess/non-standardisation of implementations)
